wget: Tool for retrieving files using HTTP, HTTPS, and FTP
curl: Command line tool for transferring files with URL syntax
ripgrep: Utility that combines the usability of The Silver Searcher with the raw speed of grep
file: Program that shows the type of files
netcat-gnu: Utility which reads and writes data across network connections
wordlists: Collection of wordlists useful for security testing
unzip: Extraction utility for archives compressed in .zip format
p7zip: New p7zip fork with additional codecs and improvements (forked from https://sourceforge.net/projects/p7zip/)
zip: Compressor/archiver for creating and modifying zipfiles
cabextract: Free Software for extracting Microsoft cabinet files
remmina: Remote desktop client written in GTK
tigervnc: Fork of tightVNC, made in cooperation with VirtualGL
samba: Standard Windows interoperability suite of programs for Linux and Unix
openvpn: Robust and highly flexible tunneling application
util-linux: Set of system utilities for Linux
vim: Most popular clone of the VI editor
wireguard-tools: Tools for the WireGuard secure network tunnel
dos2unix: Convert text files with DOS or Mac line breaks to Unix line breaks and vice versa
screen: Window manager that multiplexes a physical terminal
crowbar: Brute forcing tool that can be used during penetration tests
thc-hydra: Very fast network logon cracker which support many different services
hashcat-utils: Small utilities that are useful in advanced password cracking
metasploit: Metasploit Framework - a collection of exploits
pwntools: CTF framework and exploit development library
exploitdb: Archive of public exploits and corresponding vulnerable software
go-exploitdb: Tool for searching Exploits from Exploit Databases, etc
sploitscan: Cybersecurity utility designed to provide detailed information on vulnerabilities and associated exploits
wfuzz: Web content fuzzer to facilitate web applications assessments
gobuster: Tool used to brute-force URIs, DNS subdomains, Virtual Host names on target web servers
burpsuite: An integrated platform for performing security testing of web applications
sqlmap: Automatic SQL injection and database takeover tool
nmap: Free and open source utility for network discovery and security auditing
checksec: Tool for checking security bits on executables
bingrep: Greps through binaries from various OSs and architectures, and colors them
binwalk: Tool for searching a given binary image for embedded files
radare2: UNIX-like reverse engineering framework and command-line toolset
gef: Modern experience for GDB with advanced debugging features for exploit developers & reverse engineers
pwndbg: Exploit Development and Reverse Engineering with GDB Made Easy
ghidra-bin: Software reverse engineering (SRE) suite of tools developed by NSA's Research Directorate in support of the Cybersecurity mission
foremost: Recover files based on their contents
autopsy: Graphical interface to The Sleuth Kit and other open source digital forensics tools
exiftool: Tool to read, write and edit EXIF meta information
git-secret: Bash-tool to store your private data inside a git repository
mimikatz: Little tool to play with Windows security
nbtscan: Scan networks searching for NetBIOS information
bloodhound: Active Directory reconnaissance and attack path management tool
netexec: Network service exploitation tool (maintained fork of CrackMapExec)
